BitField.Name: spi_softreset
BitField.Notes: Device reset

BitField.Name: spi_lsb_first
BitField.Notes: Bit order for SPI port. This bit has no effect in I2C mode.

BitField.Name: spi_address_ascension
BitField.Notes: This bit controls whether the register address is automatically incremented during a multibyte transfer. This bit has no effect in I2C mode.

BitField.Name: spi_sdo_active
BitField.Notes: Enables SPI port SDO pin. This bit has no effect in I2C mode.

BitField.Name: spi_sdo_active_mirror
BitField.Notes: Enables SPI port SDO pin. This bit has no effect in I2C mode.

BitField.Name: spi_address_ascension_mirror
BitField.Notes: This bit controls whether the register address is automatically incremented during a multibyte transfer. This bit has no effect in I2C mode.

BitField.Name: spi_lsb_first_mirror
BitField.Notes: Bit order for SPI port. This bit has no effect in I2C mode.

BitField.Name: spi_softreset_mirror
BitField.Notes: Device reset

BitField.Name: spi_reset_sans_regmap
BitField.Notes: This bit resets the device while maintaining the current register settings.

BitField.Name: spi_read_buffer_register
BitField.Notes: For buffered registers, this bit controls whether the value read from the serial port is from the actual (active) registers or the buffered copy.

BitField.Name: spi_chip_type
BitField.Notes: The Analog Devices unified SPI protocol reserves this read only register location for identifying the type of device. The default value of 0x05 identifies the AD9528 as a clock IC.

BitField.Name: id_versions
BitField.Notes: The Analog Devices unified SPI protocol reserves this read only register location for identifying the die revision. Default = 0x03.

BitField.Name: spi_version
BitField.Notes: The Analog Devices unified SPI protocol reserves this read only register location for identifying the version of the unified SPI protocol. Default = 0x00.

BitField.Name: vender_id
BitField.Notes: The Analog Devices unified SPI protocol reserves this read only register location for identifying Analog Devices as the chip vendor of this device. All Analog Devices devices adhering to the unified serial port specification have the same value in this register.

BitField.Name: vender_id
BitField.Notes: The Analog Devices unified SPI protocol reserves this read only register location for identifying Analog Devices as the chip vendor of this device. All Analog Devices devices adhering to the unified serial port specification have the same value in this register.

BitField.Name: ioupdate_reg
BitField.Notes: Writing a 1 to this bit transfers the data in the serial input/output buffer registers to the internal control registers of the device. This is an autoclearing bit.

BitField.Name: inputpll_refa_div
BitField.Notes: 10-bit REFA divider. Divide by 1 to divide by 1023. 0000000000, 0000000001 = divide by 1.

BitField.Name: inputpll_refa_div
BitField.Notes: 10-bit REFA divider. Divide by 1 to divide by 1023. 0000000000, 0000000001 = divide by 1.

BitField.Name: inputpll_refb_div
BitField.Notes: 10-bit REFB divider. Divide by 1 to divide by 1023. 0000000000, 0000000001 = divide by 1.

BitField.Name: inputpll_refb_div
BitField.Notes: 10-bit REFB divider. Divide by 1 to divide by 1023. 0000000000, 0000000001 = divide by 1.

BitField.Name: inputpll_fb_div
BitField.Notes: 10-bit feedback divider. Divide by 1 to divide by 1023. 0000000000, 0000000001 = divide by 1.

BitField.Name: inputpll_fb_div
BitField.Notes: 10-bit feedback divider. Divide by 1 to divide by 1023. 0000000000, 0000000001 = divide by 1.

BitField.Name: inputpll_cp
BitField.Notes: These bits set the magnitude of the PLL1 charge pump current. Granularity is ~0.5 uA with a full-scale magnitude of ~63.5 uA.

BitField.Name: inputpll_force_holdover
BitField.Notes: Tristates the PLL1 charge pump.

BitField.Name: inputpll_cp_mode
BitField.Notes: Controls the mode of the PLL1 charge pump.

BitField.Name: pll1_holdover_disable
BitField.Notes: Disable automatic holdover.

BitField.Name: inputpll_en_vcxo_neg_se_rcvr
BitField.Description: VCXO single-ended negative pin enable CMOS mode
BitField.Notes: Selects which single-ended input pin is enabled when in the single-ended receiver mode (Register 0x0108, Bit 0 = 0). 1 = negative receiver from VCXO input (/VCXO_IN pin) selected. 0 = positive receiver from VCXO input (VCXO_IN pin) selected (default).

BitField.Name: inputpll_vcxo_rcvr_pd
BitField.Notes: Enables control over power-down of the VCXO receivers.

BitField.Name: inputpll_en_refa_rcvr
BitField.Notes: REFA receiver power-down control mode.

BitField.Name: inputpll_en_refb_rcvr
BitField.Notes: REFB receiver power-down control mode.

BitField.Name: inputpll_en_refa_neg_se_rcvr
BitField.Description: REFA single-ended negative pin enable (CMOS mode)
BitField.Notes: Selects which single-ended input pin is enabled when in single-ended receiver mode (also depends on Register 0x0108, Bit 5 = 0).

BitField.Name: inputpll_en_refb_neg_se_rcvr
BitField.Description: REFB single-ended negative pin enable (CMOS mode)
BitField.Notes: Selects which single-ended input pin is enabled when in single-ended receiver mode (also depends on Register 0x0108, Bit 6 = 0).

BitField.Name: inputpll_vcxo_out_fb
BitField.Notes: Selects the input source to the PLL1 feedback divider.

BitField.Name: inputpll_refa_divider_reset
BitField.Notes: Puts divider in reset.

BitField.Name: inputpll_refb_divider_reset
BitField.Notes: Puts divider in reset.

BitField.Name: inputpll_fb_divider_reset
BitField.Notes: Puts divider in reset.

BitField.Name: inputpll_ref_sel_mode
BitField.Notes: Programs the REFA, REFB mode selection (default = 000).

BitField.Name: inputpll_vcxo_ctl_voltage
BitField.Notes: High permits the VCXO_CTRL control voltage to be forced to midsupply when the feedback or input clocks fail. Low tristates the charge pump output.

BitField.Name: input_pll_fast_lock_cp
BitField.Notes: These bits set the magnitude of the PLL1 charge pump current. Granularity is ~0.5 uA with a full-scale magnitude of ~63.5 uA.

BitField.Name: inputpll_fast_lock_enable
BitField.Notes: Enables PLL1 fast lock operation.

BitField.Name: outputpll_cp
BitField.Notes: These bits set the magnitude of the PLL2 charge pump current. Granularity is ~3.5 uA with a full-scale magnitude of ~900 uA.

Register.Name: reg0201
Register.Notes: Feedback Divider Constraints: A Divider (Bits[7:6]) B Divider (Bits[5:0]) Allowed N Division (4 x B + A) A = 0 B = 3 N = 16 to 255 A = 0 or A = 1 B = 4 A = 0 to A = 2 B = 5 A = 0 to A = 2 B = 6 A = 0 to A = 3 B >= 7

BitField.Name: outputpll_fb_b_divider
BitField.Notes: B divider word.

BitField.Name: outputpll_fb_a_divider
BitField.Notes: A divider word.

BitField.Name: outputpll_cp_mode
BitField.Notes: Controls the mode of the PLL2 charge pump.

BitField.Name: outputpll_en_ref_freq_doubler
BitField.Notes: Enables doubling of the PLL2 reference input frequency.

BitField.Name: outputpll_ld_pd
BitField.Notes: Controls power-down of the PLL2 lock detector.

Option.Description: 1 = initiates VCO calibration (this is not an autoclearing bit).

BitField.Name: outputpll_force_vco_midpoint
BitField.Notes: Selects VCO control voltage functionality.

Option.Description: 1 = forces VCO control voltage to midscale
0 = uses the PLL1 VCXO indicator to determine when the reference clock to the PLL2 is valid
1 = treats the reference clock as valid even if PLL1 does not consider it to be valid

BitField.Name: outputpll_doubler_rdiv_path
BitField.Description: Doubler and R1 divider path enable

BitField.Name: outputpll_lf_ctl_bypass_rz
BitField.Notes: Bypasses the internal RZERO resistor (RZERO = 0 Ohm). Requires the use of a series external zero resistor. This bit is the MSB of the loop filter control register (Register 0x0205 and Register 0x0206).

BitField.Name: outputpll_r_divider
BitField.Notes: Divide by 1 to divide by 31. 00000, 00001 = divide by 1.

BitField.Name: outputpll_replica_divider
BitField.Notes: Division = Channel Divider Bits[7:0] + 1. For example, [7:0] = 0 is divided by 1, [7:0] = 1 is divided by 2...[7:0] = 255 is divided by 256.

BitField.Name: outputpll_replica_div_phase
BitField.Notes: Divider initial phase after a sync is asserted relative to the divider input clock (from the VCO divider output). LSB = 1/2 of a period of the divider input clock. Phase 0 = no phase offset. Phase 1 = 1/2 period offset. ... Phase 63 = 31.5 period offset.

BitField.Name: dist_analog_delay_ch0
BitField.Notes: 15 fine delay steps. Step size = 31 ps.

Option.Description: 0 = disables fine analog delay for the corresponding channel
1 = enables fine delay for the corresponding channel. 600 ps insertion delay

BitField.Name: dist_analog_ctl_ch0
BitField.Notes: Controls which signal source is selected by the output driver.

BitField.Name: dist_div_phase_ch0
BitField.Notes: Divider initial phase after a sync is asserted relative to the divider input clock (from the VCO divider output). LSB = 1/2 of a period of the divider input clock. Phase = 0: no phase offset. Phase = 1: 1/2 period offset ... Phase = 63: 31.5 period offset.

BitField.Name: dist_drvr_ctl_ch0
BitField.Notes: Determines the output logic to be applied.

BitField.Name: dist_div_ratio_ch0
BitField.Notes: Division = Channel divider Bits[7:0] + 1. For example, [7:0] = 0 is divided by 1, [7:0] = 1 is divided by 2...[7:0] = 255 is divided by 256. 8-bit channel divider.

BitField.Name: dist_analog_delay_ch1
BitField.Notes: 15 fine delay steps. Step size = 31 ps.

Option.Description: 0 = disables fine analog delay for the corresponding channel
1 = enables fine delay for the corresponding channel. 600 ps insertion delay

BitField.Name: dist_analog_ctl_ch1
BitField.Notes: Controls which signal source is selected by the output driver.

BitField.Name: dist_div_phase_ch1
BitField.Notes: Divider initial phase after a sync is asserted relative to the divider input clock (from the VCO divider output). LSB = 1/2 of a period of the divider input clock. Phase = 0: no phase offset. Phase = 1: 1/2 period offset ... Phase = 63: 31.5 period offset.

BitField.Name: dist_drvr_ctl_ch1
BitField.Notes: Determines the output logic to be applied.

BitField.Name: dist_div_ratio_ch1
BitField.Notes: Division = Channel divider Bits[7:0] + 1. For example, [7:0] = 0 is divided by 1, [7:0] = 1 is divided by 2...[7:0] = 255 is divided by 256. 8-bit channel divider.

BitField.Notes: 15 fine delay steps. Step size = 31 ps.

1 = enables fine delay for the corresponding channel. 600 ps insertion delay

BitField.Notes: Divider initial phase after a sync is asserted relative to the divider input clock (from the VCO divider output). LSB = 1/2 of a period of the divider input clock. Phase = 0: no phase offset. Phase = 1: 1/2 period offset ... Phase = 63: 31.5 period offset.

BitField.Notes: Determines the output logic to be applied.

BitField.Notes: Division = Channel divider Bits[7:0] + 1. For example, [7:0] = 0 is divided by 1, [7:0] = 1 is divided by 2...[7:0] = 255 is divided by 256. 8-bit channel divider.

BitField.Notes: 15 fine delay steps. Step size = 31 ps.

1 = enables fine delay for the corresponding channel. 600 ps insertion delay

BitField.Notes: Divider initial phase after a sync is asserted relative to the divider input clock (from the VCO divider output). LSB = 1/2 of a period of the divider input clock. Phase = 0: no phase offset. Phase = 1: 1/2 period offset ... Phase = 63: 31.5 period offset.

BitField.Notes: Division = Channel divider Bits[7:0] + 1. For example, [7:0] = 0 is divided by 1, [7:0] = 1 is divided by 2...[7:0] = 255 is divided by 256. 8-bit channel divider.

BitField.Notes: 15 fine delay steps. Step size = 31 ps.

Option.Description: 0 = disables fine analog delay for the corresponding channel
1 = enables fine delay for the corresponding channel. 600 ps insertion delay

BitField.Notes: Divider initial phase after a sync is asserted relative to the divider input clock (from the VCO divider output). LSB = 1/2 of a period of the divider input clock. Phase = 0: no phase offset. Phase = 1: 1/2 period offset ... Phase = 63: 31.5 period offset.

BitField.Notes: 15 fine delay steps. Step size = 31 ps.

BitField.Notes: Controls which signal source is selected by the output driver.

BitField.Notes: 15 fine delay steps. Step size = 31 ps.

BitField.Name: dist_sync
BitField.Notes: Issues SYNC on transition of bit 0 from 1 to 0.

BitField.Name: dist_mask_sync_replica
BitField.Description: PLL2 feedback N2 divider ignore sync

Option.Description: 0 = PLL2 N2 divider synchronizes to sync command
1 = PLL2 N2 divider ignores sync command

BitField.Name: dist_vcxo_bypass_outputpll
BitField.Description: Enable VCXO receiver path to distribution

BitField.Name: sysref_divider
BitField.Notes: The 16-bit K divider divides the input clock to the SYSREF pattern generator to program the SYSREF pulse width. Bits[7:0] are the LSB byte, and Bits[15:8] are the MSB byte.

BitField.Name: sysref_divider
BitField.Notes: The 16-bit K divider divides the input clock to the SYSREF pattern generator to program the SYSREF pulse width. Bits[7:0] are the LSB byte, and Bits[15:8] are the MSB byte.

BitField.Name: sysref_reset
BitField.Notes: SYSREF reset

BitField.Name: sysref_test_mode
BitField.Notes: SYSREF test mode

BitField.Name: sysref_ext_resample_clk_source
BitField.Description: Resample clock source for external SYSREF

BitField.Name: sysref_edge_mode
BitField.Notes: SYSREF pattern generator trigger control

BitField.Name: sysref_request_method
BitField.Notes: SYSREF request method

BitField.Name: sysref_spi_request
BitField.Notes: SPI SYSREF request In N-shot mode, the SYSREF pattern starts at the transition of this bit from 0 to 1 and bit automatically clears after the pattern completes In continuous or PRBS mode, SYSREF pattern starts at the transition of this bit from 0 to 1 and the bit stays set to 1 until user clears the bit; when the user clears the bit, the SYSREF pattern stops.

BitField.Name: sysref_internal_n_shot_mode
BitField.Notes: N-shot mode

BitField.Name: sysref_internal_pattern_mode
BitField.Notes: Pattern mode

BitField.Name: sysref_source_selection
BitField.Notes: SYSREF source

Option.Description: 1 = differential receiver mode, single-ended receivers disabled

BitField.Name: sysref_en_ext_negative_se_rcvr
BitField.Notes: Selects which single-ended input pin is enabled when in the SYSREF single-ended receiver mode (Register 0x0404, Bit 0 = 0).

Option.Description: 0 = positive receiver from SYSREF input (/SYSREF_IN pin) selected
1 = negative receiver from SYSREF input (/SYSREF_IN pin) selected

BitField.Name: sysref_ext_rcvr_pd
BitField.Notes: Enables control over power-down of the SYSREF input receivers.

BitField.Name: ctl_biasgen_pd
BitField.Description: Bias generation power-down disable or power-down

Option.Description: Both Refs Missing and PLL2 Locked
Both Refs Missing and PLL2 Locked

Register.Name: reg0507
Register.Description: Status pin enable and status divider enable

BitField.Name: ctl_status_pin_en_div_1
BitField.Notes: Enables a divide-by-4 on the STATUS1 pin, allowing dynamic signals to be viewed at a lower frequency (such as the PFD input clocks). Not to be used with dc states on the status pins, which occur when the settings of Register 0x0506, Bits[5:0] are in the range of 000000 to 001111.

BitField.Name: ctl_status_pin_div_en_0
BitField.Notes: Enables a divide by 4 on the STATUS0 pin, allowing dynamic signals to be viewed at a lower frequency (such as the PFD input clocks). Not to be used with dc states on the status pins, which occur when the settings of Register 0x0505, Bits[5:0] are in the range of 000000 to 001111.

BitField.Name: ctl_status_pin0_en
BitField.Notes: Enables the status on the STATUS0 pin.

BitField.Name: ctl_status_pin1_en
BitField.Notes: Enables the status on the STATUS1 pin.

BitField.Name: ctl_readback_selected_reference
BitField.Notes: Selected reference (applies only when the device automatically selects the reference; for example, not in manual control mode).

Option.Description: 1 = holdover is active (both references are missing)
